prompt.title: Knowledge

parameters.knowledgeContent: Prague is a political, cultural, and economic hub of Central Europe, with a rich history and Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque architecture. It was the capital of the Kingdom of Bohemia and residence of several Holy Roman Emperors, most notably Charles IV (r. 1346–1378) and Rudolf II (r. 1575–1611). It was an important city to the Habsburg monarchy and Austria-Hungary. The city played major roles in the Bohemian and the Protestant Reformations, the Thirty Years' War and in 20th-century history as the capital of Czechoslovakia between the World Wars and the post-war Communist era.

prompt.content:
You are experienced data researcher, extract the important knowledge from the document.

# Rules

-   Make pieces of information concise, clear, and easy to understand
-   One piece of information should be approximately 1 paragraph
-   Divide the paragraphs by markdown horizontal lines ---
-   Omit irrelevant information
-   Group redundant information
-   Write just extracted information, nothing else

# The document

Take information from this document:

> {knowledgeContent}

promptResult.content:
---

Prague is a major hub in Central Europe, serving as a center for politics, culture, and economics. The city boasts a rich architectural heritage, featuring Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque styles.

---

Prague has a significant historical importance, having been the capital of the Kingdom of Bohemia and the residence of several Holy Roman Emperors. Notable rulers who resided in Prague include Charles IV (1346-1378) and Rudolf II (1575-1611).

---

The city held a prominent position within the Habsburg monarchy and Austria-Hungary. Prague also played crucial roles in significant historical events, including the Bohemian and Protestant Reformations, as well as the Thirty Years' War.

---

In the 20th century, Prague continued to be historically significant as the capital of Czechoslovakia between the World Wars and during the post-war Communist era.

> Prague is a political, cultural, and economic hub of Central Europe, with a rich history and Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque architecture. It was the capital of the Kingdom of Bohemia and residence of several Holy Roman Emperors, most notably Charles IV (r. 1346–1378) and Rudolf II (r. 1575–1611). content.text:
---

Prague is a major hub in Central Europe, serving as a center for politics, culture, and economics. The city boasts a rich architectural heritage, featuring Romanesque, Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque styles.

---

Prague has a significant historical importance, having been the capital of the Kingdom of Bohemia and the residence of several Holy Roman Emperors. Notable rulers who resided in Prague include Charles IV (1346-1378) and Rudolf II (1575-1611).

---

The city held a prominent position within the Habsburg monarchy and Austria-Hungary. Prague also played crucial roles in significant historical events, including the Bohemian and Protestant Reformations, as well as the Thirty Years' War.

---

In the 20th century, Prague continued to be historically significant as the capital of Czechoslovakia between the World Wars and during the post-war Communist era.
